pastHistory.string: 3. Coronary atherosclerosis treated with bypass surgery.
4. Multiple transient cerebral ischemic attacks treated with vertebrobasilar angioplasty.
5. Repairs of an abdominal aortic aneurysm.

pastTests.string: 1. Left orchiectomy for epididymitis and orchitis.

pastTreatments.string: 3. Both joints injected with corticosteroids without relief of symptoms.

recentHistory.string: 1. Several stenoses in the coronary arteries
2. Masses present on his left wrist and right elbow for about six months prior to admission.

healthCase.start: A 75-year-old white male was admitted to the medical center complaining of chest pain radiating to his left arm, and pain in the left wrist and elbow.

results.string: Blood pressure: Normal Heart Rate: Normal Respiration Rate: Normal Temperature: 38.5
Ill-defined area of parenchymal infiltration involving the lower lobe of the right lung, consistent with a pneumonia, and minimal amount of right-sided pleural effusion.
Susceptibility to Streptomycin, Isoniazid, Rifampin, Ethambutol, and Pyrazinamide.

image.description: Chronic granulomatous epididymitis and granulomatous orchitis.
image.name: micro1.jpg

image.description: Chronic granulomatous epididymitis and granulomatous orchitis.

image.description: Chronic granulomatous epididymitis and granulomatous orchitis.

image.description: Ill-defined intra-articular bodies anterior to the ulna consistent with TB arthritis.
image.name: gross1.jpg

results.string: Loss of articular cartilage of the capitulum, the radial head, and moderately of the trochlea on the olecranon process of the ulna.
Sodium urate crystals were found in fluid aspirated from the left wrist.
